lead_paragraph: Brian Howard, 37, a suburban Chicago contractor, pleaded guilty to setting a fire at a radar facility before trying to commit suicide by slitting his throat.

headline.print_headline: Illinois: Guilty Plea in Fire at Radar Facility
headline.main: Illinois: Guilty Plea in Fire at Radar Facility

snippet: Brian Howard, 37, a suburban Chicago contractor, pleaded guilty to setting a fire at a radar facility before trying to commit suicide by slitting his throat.
abstract: Chicago area contractor Brian Howard pleads guilty to setting fire at radar facility in Aurora, Ill, that disrupted thousands of flights and impeded travel nationwide in September 2014; disruption had forced O'Hare and Midway international airports to shut down for hours.
